intro: Dalechampia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan humpback, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, spiny stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
